definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The mound can be used as our screen.
sentences.chinese: 这个土丘可做我们的掩蔽物。

sentences.english: When I was 12, I learned to juggle on the side of a gravel hill with oranges.
sentences.chinese: 我十二岁是，我学会了在沙土丘边用橘子杂耍。

sentences.english: The Island of Dreams is a mound of earth blanketed in vibrant wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: “梦之岛”是一个覆盖满了鲜艳野花的小土丘。

sentences.english: It was easy to pick holes in the mound.
The house is set on top of a small mound surrounded by birch trees.
sentences.chinese: 房子建设在一个小土丘的顶部，周围被桦树包围。

sentences.english: Termite mounds three metres tall tower above the flat plains.
sentences.chinese: 耸立在平原上的白蚁土丘竟高达三米。

sentences.english: Nest mound patrollers may assess humidity and temperature.
sentences.chinese: 巢穴土丘巡逻蚂蚁或许也评估湿度和气温。

sentences.english: Located to the east of Dashuifa, Xianfashan was a round hill topped with a Western-style octagonal pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 位于大水法之东，在圆形土丘上建西式八方亭。

definition: halfway up a mountain/lit. waist of mountain
